content: Investments PFF Panel 4 Seedly PFF 2019 Asked by AnonymousAsked on 02 Mar 2019How much of your salary did you set aside to get started on building your portfolio? What about for average Singaporeans?3 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Junus EuTop Contributor (Sep)Level 8. WizardAnswered on 13 Mar 2019I started off setting aside at least 50% of my salary from the time I got my first paycheck and it is possible once you determine the kind of lifestyle you need and it's relating budget. It works for me - my aim was to hit six figure savings by 25, and also to buy freehold property by that age. I missed by target for property buying by one year (i was 26 then).Bottom line is - it always helps to have a monthly goal!0 comments1

Dawn FionaLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 05 Mar 2019Hmm I saved $20,000 in my first year of work (http://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/2014/12/how-i-saved-20000-in-year.html) and so I used that to start with.But you can also start earlier even with just $100 a month! Like RSS plans (http://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/2019/03/regular-shares-savings-plans-super-simple-method-to-invest.html)0 comments0

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 03 Mar 2019Im still studying but im aiming to save and invest at least 50% of my income once i start working.0 comments0
